name: Marriott's Waiohai Beach Club

reviews.text: We stayed here only one night and I am so glad because I didn't sleep more than 1 hour. There was a rooster right out our window that ear plugs, ceiling fan, closed windows could not drown out. I talked with management in the morning and they were very nice, said they try to move the roosters often and did refund a part of our night's stay but I would not return ever. The condo was beautiful and the grounds nice, though. We were there during Easter vacation and the room rate was quite high so in my opinion, not worth the cost.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort, Loud Chickens!

likes.liked: — The rooms are beautiful and comfortable

reviews.text: Our family of 4 are owners of the Marriott Ko Olina timeshare and we exchanged a week to stay at a 2 bedroom unit at Kauai’s Marriott Waiohai during our spring break vacation in March 2008. The Marriott exceeded our expectations as far as location on Poipu Beach, the condition of the unit and property and overall environment for a relaxing family holiday.
reviews.title: A Great Family Resort

likes.liked: — Condition of Timeshare units and overall property location on the beach

reviews.title: Kauai 50
reviews.text: Timeshare Unit – Our 2 bedroom unit was more than spacious and could easily sleep 8. As a family of 4 it really felt like we lived in a beachside condominium as it contained practically everything we needed: beautifully decorated furnishings, lavish finishes in the bathroom, spacious kitchen, and a large balcony allowing the 4 of us to dine ‘al fresco’ with a view to the landscaped gardens, pools and the ocean. We were quite happy and had no complaints about the condition of our 4th floor unit in Hale Seven of the resort.

On one of our excursions we met a family who booked at the other Marriott timeshare on Kauai, the Marriott Kauai Beach Club in Lihue. While they said the property was very nice, the units were re-converted hotel rooms with no full kitchen. The Waiohai 2-bedroom floor plan follows a very similar layout of the newer Marriott timeshares we have experienced in Ko Olina, Orlando and Las Vegas – nicely laid out, spacious and beautifully furnished.
reviews.title: Not A Full Service Hotel

reviews.text: Property Overall – Compared to the Marriott Ko Olina on Oahu, the Kauai Waiohai seemed much more intimate and laid back, a feeling that best describes the island overall. The lobby and public areas were much smaller and subdued, but very well maintained. The staff was extremely helpful and courteous. On our first day we hung out by the beach and the pool and decided to have lunch at the beachside bar … over priced for what we got, but convenient. That is when we decided to go to the Costco in Lihue town and stock up on breakfast, lunch and dinner foods allowing us to cook in for a few of the days (and saving a ton of money). The fitness room was small by comparison to Ko Olina and had no windows, but was decently maintained as far as hotel fitness rooms are concerned.
reviews.title: Terrific Resort

likes.liked: — The spaciousness of the rooms and laid back

reviews.text: Condo was nice, but feeling very cheated by this resort and the fact that nobody at the hotel or Marriott corporate cares about customer service. We've stayed at other Marriott properties before and the fact that the situation even occurred, then nobody did anything about it, was surprising. We upgraded to an "ocean view" room, and ended up with a view of a public parking lot, complete with tour buses, dumpsters/garbage trucks, car alarms going off, etc. Photo attached. Parking lot view should be lower cost than island view - this seems like a greedy trick to me. Hotel staff unwilling to adjust price and no other rooms were available. No response from Marriott corporate after I filled out their survey - so I guess they just plan to keep disappointing people with this one.
reviews.title: Deceptive Practices

likes.liked: — Deceptive advertising and lack of customer service

reviews.text: We just returned from the Waiohai on July 21. My husband asked me if I would return and I have to think about that one. Luckily we had a gorgeous view of the ocean and were in Hale 1 on the second floor. We were told we were quite lucky to get that one as usually only owners there were the special ones to get Hale 1. Our friends traveling with us weren't quite as fortunate, as they were put in Hale 5. It could have had something to do with the check in. We arrived on Sunday and they arrived on the Friday before. I would say we got lucky.
reviews.title: Waiohai needs to do something about the roosters!

reviews.text: We are owner's at the Marriott KoOlina Beach Club. We are going back to Oahu next year. Even with the traffic and the overcrowded Honolulu, the KoOlina is away from all that.
reviews.title: Ground Floor Great for Families / Babies

likes.liked: — Ground floor beach front access and big pool
likes.disliked: — Never tried room service - I don't think it was offered?

reviews.text: Pros of the Waiohai: great beach, not far from great places to eat. Try The Beach House. Make reservations early for a great seat. It was the best on the island. Roy's across the street in the shopping area was also wonderful but loud and hated the seating. Underground parking is good and they don't charge which is a plus. Kauai Pasta in Lihue is a great place to eat. We had time to kill before our late night flight so it was perfect. Prices are very reasonable. It is just north of the McDonalds next to the 7 Eleven. Kind of hard to find (you can pass right by it) but well worth it.
reviews.title: Wonderful Week at Waiohai!

likes.disliked: — The colors on the interior corridors.

reviews.text: Cons: ROOSTERS! 3 AM crowing till 7 AM. Even with ear plugs they drove us nuts! Just for that reason I will still have to think twice about going back. We went down to the Marriott Beach Club (Lihue) for our last day and even though the two rooms combined lacked the space of the Waiohai and the full kitchen (had a mini kitchen with microwave and small dishwasher) it was nicer. Also, the restaurant was closed Monday through Thursday. I know most people do choose to cook in their units, it would be nice to be able to go down for coffee instead of having to get it in the market. We noticed that the employees were not nearly as friendly as the KoOlina. We did have a great presentation of the place by Rick. Nice guy and no pressure to buy. Be sure if you are getting your drinks and coffee in the market place to ask for a punch card. (Get a free one with so many purchases) They finally gave me one on my 6th day! You would think they would ask people if they have one to begin with. Gezzzz I also had a tough time at the computer trying to print boarding passes. I was behind some guy that took forever. Then it took me forever because of their computer. They need chairs.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: We are in the midst of a stay at the Waiohai Beach Club. We are owners at the Ko Olina and traded into the Waiohai Beach Club. The layout on the Waiohai is spread out in 8 buildings (hale 1, hale 2, etc.). Because the buildings are spread out, you need to pay greater attention to your room requests than you would at a high rise like the Ko Olina.
reviews.title: Great Timeshare In Right Building
Fine Property, Great Location
reviews.text: Overall we are having a great stay. There were, however, a couple of hiccups on the way in. We are traveling with my inlaws, and my father in law is mobility impaired. We requested a room centrally located to ensure he did not have to walk far distances (he uses a cane). We arrived at midnight and were told that we were in Hale 6 with an exterior island view. The desk clerk apologized and basically told us that she passed along all of our requests to the manager on duty but that he ignored all of our requests. We asked for a high floor, centrally located with a view of the internal courtyard. We got a ground floor in the building furthest from parking (Hale 6) with a view of a neighboring public parking area just west of the Waiohai. We called back in the morning, spoke to the manager on duty (Monet, not the same one who originally placed us) and she was great. She and a desk clerk named Joanna both helped out tremendously and moved us to Hale 7, which has underground parking very close to our room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great Marriott property, but I would recommend that anyone booking a stay here plan on getting in early the first day and making sure to request a room with an interior view of the courtyard, as all exterior view rooms look upon neighboring construction or a public parking lot to the West. I would also echo the previous reviews that suggest avoiding Hale 4, particularly the exterior view that looks out on a parking lot.
reviews.title: part of great kauai honeymoon

likes.disliked: — some units are far from pools and ocean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Marriott Waiohai is a fantastic property. As an owner, I hope to help others enjoy the property by setting expectations. This is not a full service hotel or resort - by design. That does not mean that I do not grumble about a few missing elements. Do not expect a bell hop - the property is currently working with Marriott and the board to offer this service. Tip: There are luggage carts (usually 3 or 4) at the elevators within the underground parking. There is usually one at check in as well. Do not expect 4 or 5 star dining at the resort. The food is minimalist. The Honu Bar, poolside, has great drinks, but try to come prepared by lining up your food stash prior to arrival - don't pay $10 bucks for a salad in a plastic shell. The Kiawe Grill is closed Tuesday and Wednesday (this is the closest thing to full service restaurant on the property). Tip: stop a Sueoka's Market in Koloa town for your food and drink. They have a ton of local food - portuguese sausage, ahi/tako poke, and more. Also, they have a reasonable selection of beer, wine, etc. For excellent dinners out, try the Beach House (towards spouting horn) and Roy's Poipu across the street at the Shopping Village. These are expensive alternatives, but worth it. The views at the Beach House are stunning (also, try the top shelf Mai Tai). Tip: For less expensive local fare, head into Lihue for breakfast (Tip Top Cafe or Oki Diner). The food is more asian influence - i.e. - Miso or Saimin for breakfast to complement pancakes, eggs etc. Try the Moco Loco breakfast especially if you are gearing up for a long hike in Waimea Canyon.
reviews.title: Beautiful property

reviews.text: The best part about this property is that you can relax in fantastic accommodations. Spacious rooms, steps to the ocean, quiet/sound proof rooms (you'll see when you close sliding glass door at your lanai) , well behaved children (we have none), friendly people, planned activities for the kids, adult/quiet areas - jacuzzi/pool and not crowded whatsoever. There is really no comparison to the Marriott Kauai Beach Resort. Aside from the restaurant selections, the Waiohai cannot be beat. Must be a reason they are nearly sold out after a short selling period.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — Quality room, BBQ's, non-watery drinks at the bar, location

reviews.text: We stayed at the Waiohai last Thanksgiving and had a great time. Myself, husband, and 3 year old daughter shared a unit with my parents. It was awesome - two big bedrooms, two bathrooms, kitchen and living room, and the best part, a washer and dryer. The property is very nice, right on the beach. The pool was great. All I can say is we had so much fun. Great for families. Maybe not so exciting if you are looking to party or for nightlife. But for a pregnant woman with her family it was perfect. We got the 5 night deal and had to go to the timeshare presentation. That wasn't so much fun, but definitely worth it. We knew from the start that we wouldn't be purchasing a timeshare. Once the presentation went over the advertised 90 mins I basically told the guy we wouldn't be buying a timeshare. That's when he kind of turned and tried to make you feel like an idiot for not getting in on such a great deal. But like I said, it was worth it. I would recommend this property to anyone looking for a relaxing vacation. And yes, this is not a full service hotel. No room service or bellboy - something else to keep in mind if that is what you are looking for. We would definitely return.
reviews.title: Great time at the Waiohai

reviews.text: This is the best of the best as far as time-share condo's go. We got a two bedroom condo with a beach/pool view. It was the most relaxing place I have ever been to in my entire life. It is equipped with a full kitchen with all necessary cooking and dining items including coffee pot, microwave, stove, oven, refrigerator and dishwasher. It was very clean on arrival. While they supply towels, it is up to the users to keep them clean, but there is a full sized washer and dryer in the bathroom, so that makes it easy! They furnish beach towels as well. They have great Lanai's on each room and we spent almost every evening enjoying the sunset on it. The musty smell must have been from the property being so close to the ocean, but it wasnt enough that it bothered us at all! Love it so much, I would go back tomorrow!
reviews.title: Awesome Resort!!!

likes.disliked: — A bit of a musty smell.
